channel.title: math.AT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Homotopy classification of closed polygonal lines: results and problems
item.description: arXiv:2508.16287v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this text we expose (as a sequence of problems) basic cases of some fundamental ideas and methods of mathematics. Namely, of homotopy, degree, fundamental group, covering, Whitehead invariant, etc. This is done by considering the elementary example: closed polygonal lines in a subset of the plane. Although these ideas and methods are parts of topology, they are used in many other areas including computer science. This text is expository and is accessible to mathematicians not specialized in the area (and to students).
item.dc:creator: E. Alkin, O. Nikitenko, A. Skopenkov

item.title: On the Classification of Planar-Rips complexes and their corresponding unit disk graphs
item.description: arXiv:2406.01082v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Given a metric space $(X,d)$, the Vietoris-Rips complex of $X$ at a scale of $r >0$ is a simplicial complex whose simplices are all those finite subsets of $X$ with diameter less than $r$. In this paper, we classify, up to simplicial isomorphism, all $n$-dimensional pseudomanifolds and weak-pseudomanifolds that can be realized as a Vietoris-Rips complex of planar point sets. We further classify two-dimensional, pure, and closed planar-Rips complexes up to homotopy. Additionally, we explore the hereditary properties and introduce the notion of obstructions in planar-Rips complexes. We also consolidate our findings to describe a class of unit disk graphs, having all maximal cliques of same cardinality. Several structural and geometric properties of planar-Rips complexes have also been derived.
item.dc:creator: Vinay Sipani, Ramesh Kasilingam

item.title: A short proof of the universality of the relative Rezk nerve
item.description: arXiv:2505.14123v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We give a concise, conceptual proof of the universality of the relative Rezk nerve, due to Mazel-Gee.
item.dc:creator: Kensuke Arakawa, Bastiaan Cnossen
